alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Chesterfield; Powhatan (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 8:07AM EST until further notice by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... James River At Cartersville affecting Goochland, Powhatan and Cumberland Counties. James River At Richmond Westham affecting Henrico, City of Richmond and Chesterfield Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Appomattox River Above Farmville affecting Prince Edward, Amelia and Cumberland Counties. Appomattox River At Mattoax affecting Powhatan, Amelia and Chesterfield Counties. For the Lower James Basin...including Richmond Locks, Cartersville, Richmond Westham...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Appomattox Basin...including Farmville, Mattoax, Matoaca... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Appomattox River at Mattoax. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Agricultural and pasture land flooded. At 25.0 feet, Agricultural and some secondary roads flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM EST Thursday the stage was 21.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 AM EST Thursday was 21.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 24.1 feet Saturday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.2 feet on 06/24/1938. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 345 PM EST.
